cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip2: Set the voltage for the CPU Core.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip116: Set the maximum core multiplier at which the cores can operate. The value of the core frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip117: Set the maximum core multiplier at which the cores can operate. The value of the core frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip118: Set the maximum core multiplier at which the cores can operate. The value of the core frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip119: Set the maximum core multiplier at which the cores can operate. The value of the core frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip34: A voltage offset from the current core voltage.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip120: Set the maximum core multiplier at which the cores can operate. The value of the core frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip121: Set the maximum core multiplier at which the cores can operate. The value of the core frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip76: Set the maximum processor cache multiplier at which the caches can operate. The value of the cache frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip77: Voltage that is supplied to the processor's internal cache interface based on the currently selected cache voltage mode.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip79: Final voltage offset that is applied to the Cache Voltage.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip122: Set the maximum core multiplier at which the cores can operate. The value of the core frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip123: Set the maximum core multiplier at which the cores can operate. The value of the core frequency is the product of this ratio and the reference clock frequency.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip102: Set ICCMAX for Processor Core Voltage Regulator.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip106: Set ICCMAX for Processor Cache and Ring Bus Voltage Regulator.
cpuOCTips.cpuOCTip114: To derive the effective active core ratio limit when AVX is active, subtract this value to the corresponding active core ratio limit.

gpuOCTips.gpuOCTip0: Add an offset to GPU clock frequency.
gpuOCTips.gpuOCTip1: Add an offset to memory clock frequency.

details.title: Battery Details
details.fccTooltipText: To extend your battery's lifespan, we have optimized its full charge capacity based on your usage. Full battery capacity may not be available until you discharge to 20% and recharge.

condition.Illegal: The battery installed is not supported by the system and will not charge. Please replace the battery with the correct Lenovo battery for this system.
condition.Exhaustion: The battery capacity has been degraded. Please replace a new one.
condition.Bad: A battery error has occurred. The battery cannot be charged/discharged. Replace the battery.
condition.NotGood: The battery is not in a good Condition.
condition.NotSupportACAdapterDetail: AC adapter not supported. Your Lenovo computer doesn't support this AC adapter. It may cause sudden shutdown. Please connect a correct AC adapter.
condition.LimitedACAdapterSupportDetail: AC adapter cannot provide enough power to your Lenovo computer that will impact system performance and charging speed. Please reconnect the proper AC adapter.
condition.MissingDriver: The Lenovo Power Manager driver is not installed or not working properly. Please run Windows Update to install the latest driver. You also can install the driver from here. After the installation, restart your computer.
condition.StoreLimitation: The battery can only store {{value}}% of it's original full charge capacity.
condition.HighTemperature: Discharging has been stopped because the battery temperature is too high.
condition.TrickleCharge: The battery was completely discharged and needs to be recharged. This might take ten hours or more.
condition.OverheatedBattery: The battery is too hot. Remove it from the computer and cool it to room temperature.
condition.PermanentError: The battery capacity has been degraded. Please replace a new one.
condition.EmDriverInstalled: Battery details unavailable. Please run Windows Update->Check for updates to install the Lenovo ACPI - Compliant Virtual Power Controllerdriver.

power.title: Power
power.subtitle: Power Settings
power.description: This section enables you to dynamically adjust thermal performance and maximize the battery life. It also has other popular power-related features. You can check the default settings in this section and customize your system according to your needs.

powerSmartSettings.title: Power Smart settings
powerSmartSettings.subtitle: Intelligent Cooling
powerSmartSettings.description1: When on, this feature dynamically adjusts thermal settings to your needs. It adjusts settings to keep the device cool and quiet while being held or idle. While the device is on a stable surface, it optimizes the performance. When off, you can manually set the thermal priority.
powerSmartSettings.nocqldesc: Intelligent Cooling enables you to adjust the system performance and thermal temperature. In "Performance" mode, it optimizes the system performance. While it helps to keep the system cooler or quieter in "Cool & quiet" mode.
powerSmartSettings.description2: Intelligent Cooling adjusts fan speed, maximum surface temperature and performance. This feature has below modes and are now accessible by Windows performance power slider.
powerSmartSettings.description3: Intelligent Cooling automatically balances thermal performance to adjust to your needs. The Intelligent Cooling feature adjusts performance settings to provide a cooler surface for your comfort, when the notebook is being held. When the device is on a desktop surface, this feature optimizes performance.
powerSmartSettings.description13: When on, this feature dynamically adjusts thermal settings to your needs. It adjusts settings to keep the device cool and quiet while being held or idle. While the device is on a stable surface, it optimizes the performance. When off, you can manually set the thermal priority.
powerSmartSettings.description14: This feature enables you to adjust your fan speed, maximize the system performance, or extend your battery life if needed. It has three modes below. You also can switch the modes using hotkeys (Fn+Q) or from Lenovo Vantage Toolbar.
powerSmartSettings.description5: Intelligent Cooling adjusts fan speed, maximum performance, and manages your battery life. This feature has 3 modes (Quiet mode, Balanced mode and Performance mode) and is now accessible by the Windows performance power slider

gotoWindows.title: Go to windows settings
gotoWindows.modalBodyText1: Click on Windows battery icon on System tray to access Windows performance power slider

intelligentCooling.title: Intelligent Cooling
intelligentCooling.apsHint: To enable Intelligent Cooling, you must install and enable Lenovo Active Protection System.

selectedModeText.quiteCool: This mode enables the best experience with fan speed and system performance balanced. For example, when in gaming, it optimizes the performance. While in the office, it reduces the noise.
selectedModeText.batterySaving: This mode enables the maximum battery life by automatically adjusting the brightness, changing the power settings, disabling features on advanced image processing, etc.
selectedModeText.performance: This mode enables the maximum system performance. In this mode, the fast fan speed might cause big noise.

readMore.line1: Slider is far left. The fan speed and performance are lowered for a cooler, quieter computer and best battery life.
readMore.line2: Slider is in the center. Fan speed and performance are dynamically balanced for the best experience.
readMore.line3: Slider is far right. Fan speed and permissible surface temperature are higher for maximum performance.

coolingModesList.list1: Click on the windows battery-icon in the toolbar
coolingModesList.list2: The windows battery gauge will appear, slide the slider to choose between optimal time or optimal performance.

dytc6.desc1: Intelligent Cooling adjusts fan speed, maximum performance, and manages your battery life.
dytc6.desc2: The feature has modes listed below and now is adjusted by Windows performance power slider. You can access it by clicking the battery icon in the Windows system tray.
dytc6.desc3: Some of the modes can automatically adjust across a wider range of performance based on your activity. To enable automatic mode, press Fn+ T.
dytc6.desc3_1: Some of the modes can automatically adjust across a wider range of performance based on your activity. To disable automatic mode, press Fn+ T.

autoMode.desc1: The slider is on the left. The mode is dynamically switched to Quiet mode or Battery mode for the best DC mode experience.
autoMode.desc2: The slider is in the center or center right. The mode is dynamically switched to Quiet mode, Balanced mode or Performance mode for the best AC mode experience.
autoMode.desc3: The slider is far right. Fan speed and permissible surface temperature are higher for maximum performance.

manualMode.desc1: The slider is on the left. Fan speed and performance are lowered for a cooler, quieter computer and best battery life.
manualMode.desc2: The slider is in the center or center right. Fan speed and performance are dynamically balanced for the best experience.
manualMode.desc3: The slider is far right. Fan speed and permissible surface temperature are higher for maximum performance.

alwaysUSB.title: Always on USB
alwaysUSB.description: Charge USB devices through the Always on USB connector on the computer, when the computer is in sleep, hibernation, or off mode. A smartphone or tablet can be charged quickly from the USB connector that is yellow-coded or silk-printed with these icons:
alwaysUSB.checkbox: Enable USB charging from laptop battery when computer is off.

easyResume.title: Easy Resume
easyResume.description: Enable this feature to improve your resume time if you frequently open and close your computer's lid.
easyResume.tooltip: This feature will improve your resume time if you frequently open and close your computer’s lid. When enabled, your computer will enter a low power mode when you close its lid, but it will resume instantly if you reopen your lid within 15 minutes of closing it. This feature also allows your notebook to attempt to finish pending activities (such as sending email or downloading a file) before the system goes into suspend.

flipToBoot.title: Flip to boot
flipToBoot.description: This feature enables you to turn on your computer when you open the computer lid, just the same as you pressing the power button.
flipToBoot.tooltip: This feature automatically starts the computer by opening the lid.  It is especially useful if you have set up the face log-in information in Windows Hello.

vantageToolbar.title: Lenovo Vantage Toolbar
vantageToolbar.description: Pin Vantage Toolbar to the Windows task bar to easily get more battery details and access to your quick settings.

smartStandby.title: Smart standby
smartStandby.description: This feature schedules your computer to optimize battery power savings during idle hours without sacrificing fast-resume experience of Modern Standby during hours of heavier use.
smartStandby.tooltip: When Smart Standby is enabled, your computer switches to Modern Standby before the scheduled START time and enters hibernation after it is inactive for a certain period of time on battery power. This time period is optimized based on the schedule you set, or your computer usage. The computer switches from hibernation to Modern Standby only on scheduled days , and does not switch when it is inactive for consecutive scheduled days.
smartStandby.oldTooltipText: When Smart Standby is enabled, your computer switches to Modern Standby before the scheduled START time and enters hibernation after it is inactive for a certain period of time on battery power. This time period is optimized based on the schedule you set. The computer switches from hibernation to Modern Standby only on scheduled days, and does not switch when it is inactive for consecutive scheduled days.
smartStandby.subTitle: Schedule your computer
smartStandby.description2: This feature schedules your computer to optimize battery power savings during idle hours without sacrificing fast-startup time during hours of heavier use.
smartStandby.subTitle2: Set time when you typically use this computer
smartStandby.subNote: Your computer is scheduled for quicker resume based on the usage.

timer.heading: The time you typically use this computer:
timer.endTimeNote: END time must be within 20 hours from START time

smartStandby.warningtip: Please select at least one day.
smartStandby.checkbox: Auto adjusting your computer's active time based on your usage
smartStandby.hyperlinkToGraph: Click to see the usage and applied active time

graph.graphSubtittle: In these time periods, we keep the computer ready for quicker resume.
graph.graphNote: The activity data of this computer is not sufficient to provide a profile for automatic scheduling. Smart Standby will use the Manual mode schedule until enough data is available.

batteryThreshold.title: Battery Charge Threshold
batteryThreshold.description: If you primarily use your computer with the AC adapter attached and only infrequently use battery power, you can increase the lifespan of the battery by setting the maximum charge value to below 100%. This is useful because batteries that are used infrequently have a longer lifespan when they are maintained at less than a full charge.
batteryThreshold.tooltip: If your battery is currently charged above the stop-charging threshold, detach the power until the battery discharges to or below the stop-charging threshold. Depending on the battery status (old or new), the exact point at which the charging starts or stops might vary by up to 2 percentage points. If you enable the feature, it is recommended that you perform a Battery Gauge Reset occasionally to ensure an accurate report of the battery health.
batteryThreshold.noteInfo: Battery Charge Threshold is still not fully active. Please unplug your machine and allow your battery to drain to or below the stop-charging threshold.

popup.title: Enable Battery Charge Threshold
popup.description1: Enabling a custom battery charge will allow for the overall battery health to last longer as you use this device. However, not having a full charge will allow less runtime battery life.
popup.description2: In order to fully enable this feature, please unplug your machine and allow your battery to drain to or below the stop-charging threshold.

options.checkboxText: Automatically set the start charging threshold 5 percentage points below the stop charging threshold.

gaugeReset.title: Battery gauge reset
gaugeReset.description: This feature enables your computer to estimate the full charge capacity more accurately.
gaugeReset.percentNote: Note: During the process, the battery percentage might fluctuate.
gaugeReset.progressText1: Step {{stage}}, out of {{stageNum}} steps in total: Calibrating to full charge
gaugeReset.progressText2: Step {{stage}}, out of {{stageNum}} steps in total: Calibrating to low battery power
gaugeReset.progressText3: Step {{stage}}, out of {{stageNum}} steps in total: Calibrating to high battery power
gaugeReset.note: Note: Before resetting the battery gauge, be sure to connect your computer to ac power.
gaugeReset.dual_note: Note: Only one battery can be reset at a time.

resetLog.ERROR_AC_DETTACH: Failed: AC power adapter was detached.

popup.description1:
The resetting process is as follows:
Fully charge the battery --> Discharge to low battery power --> Recharge to high battery power or full charge
popup.description2:
Notes:
1. The process may take several hours. Please avoid using the computer during this period.
2. Close all open apps and connect your computer to ac power.
3. During the process, the battery charge threshold function is disabled.
popup.description3: Are you sure you want to stop the battery gauge reset?

expressCharging.title: Rapid Charge
expressCharging.description: Rapid Charge allows your battery to a full charge much faster than normal mode.
expressCharging.tooltip: Rapid Charge allows you to charge your system battery much faster but this may reduce the lifetime of the battery.

conservationMode.title: Conservation Mode
conservationMode.description:
This function is useful to extend the lifespan of your battery when plugged.
When this mode is enabled, the battery will only be charged to 55-60% of capacity and the battery lifespan can be maximized. However, this will shorten the time you use your computer after it is disconnected from the AC power source.

tooltip.line1: This function is useful to extend the lifespan of your battery when plugged.
tooltip.line2: When this mode is enabled, the battery will only be charged to 55-60% of capacity and the battery lifespan can be maximized. However, this will shorten the time you use your computer after it is disconnected from the AC power source.
tooltip.line3: Note: Rapid Charge and Conservation mode cannot work at the same time. IF one of the modes is turned on, the other one will be automatically turned off.

airPlanePower.title: Airplane Power Mode
airPlanePower.description: This feature enables you to use the ac power outlet on an airplane where a certain power limit applies. In this mode, the power consumption of your computer is reduced to a safe level by limiting the battery charge rate and computer performance.
airPlanePower.note: If Auto detection is checked, your computer will turn on Airplane power mode automatically when it detects an airplane onboard environment and turn off it when you leave.

dpm.title: Power
dpm.subtitle: Power settings
dpm.description: This section enables you check the default settings and customize your power use and power plan according to your needs.

globalPowerSettings.title: Global power settings
globalPowerSettings.description: This feature will override Power plan or Power use settings.

powerPlan.title: Power plan
powerPlan.description: Choose a power plan to control the computer performance, system temperature, and power usage.

audio.title: Audio
audio.subtitle: Audio Settings
audio.description: This section enables you to automatically optimize or fully configure your audio settings manually, such as Dolby settings, microphone, etc.

audioSmartsettings.title: Audio Smart settings
audioSmartsettings.subtitle: APPLICATION-BASED SETTINGS
audioSmartsettings.description: Automatically adjust audio settings according to different apps you are using.

dolby.title: Automatic Dolby Audio settings
dolby.tooltip: Automatic Dolby Audio settings configures Dolby audio settings to the appropriate mode for different apps you are using to enhance your audio experience.

voip.title: Automatic Audio Optimization for VoIP
voip.tooltip: Automatically switch to Dolby Voice mode during VoIP calls to deliver clear, consistent voice quality.

note.title: Note
note.description: Lenovo Vantage does not have permission to access your microphone. Please turn on access to your microphone for the Lenovo Vantage app.

microphone.title: Microphone
microphone.tooltip: You can customize your MIC effect by adjusting the microphone volume and specify appropriate mode.

volume.title: Microphone Volume
volume.description: Dolby Audio delivers rich, clear, powerful sound from all the content you enjoy, select appropriate mode for your content and equipment.

suppress.title: Suppress Keyboard Noise
suppress.tooltip: Toggle this on to optimize the MIC audio by suppressing keyboard noise.

acoustic.title: Acoustic Echo Cancellation
acoustic.tooltip: Toggle on this feature to optimize your MIC audio by reducing acoustic echo.

optimize.title: Optimize my microphone for:
optimize.tooltip: Configure microphone effect to enhance your audio experience by different scenarios and environment.

displayCamera.title: Display & Camera
displayCamera.subtitle: Display & camera settings
displayCamera.description: This section enables you to improve your visual experience and configure your camera properties. Explore more features and customize your display experience here.

displayColorTemperature.title: Display color temperature
displayColorTemperature.description: You can adjust the color temperature of your display to emit blue light and reduce eye strain. Adjusts displays to warmer colors during sunset to sunrise to help you sleep.

eyeCareMode.title: Color Temperature in Eye Care Mode
eyeCareMode.checkbox: Schedule eye care mode from sunset to sunrise
eyeCareMode.tooltip: Eye Care Mode adjusts the color temperature of your display to filter out blue light and reduce eye strain.
eyeCareMode.onSunsetToSunriseScheduleDescription: Schedule eye care mode from sunset to sunrise

note.title: Note
note.description: Lenovo Vantage need to access your location information for calculating the sunset and sunrise time of your region.

eyeCareMode.tips: Please run Windows Update or manually install graphics driver to recover Eye Care mode

oledPowerSettings.title: OLED Power Settings
description: Your computer's OLED display can also reduce power consumption and increase battery life by selectively dimming portions of the display.
It is also recommended to dim the task bar and other areas of the display that do not change frequently to prolong the overall lifetime of the display.
oledPowerSettings.tooltip: This feature can reduce power consumption and increase battery life by selectively dimming portions of the display.

dropDown.halfTime: Half time of display off timer

dispColorTemp.title: Daytime Color Temperature
dispColorTemp.tooltip: Eye Care Mode adjusts the color temperature of your display to filter out blue light and reduce eye strain.
dispColorTemp.onSunsetToSunriseScheduleDescription: Schedule eye care mode from sunset to sunrise

note.title: Note
note.description: When the Eye Care Mode is enabled, this color temperature does not take effect. However, you can drag the slider to get a preview of it. To make it effective, turn off the Eye Care Mode.

privacyGuard.title: Privacy Guard
privacyGuard.description: This feature prevents other people from peeking at your screen. When on, it changes the viewing angle of your display, keeping it private from those around you. You also can toggle modes by pressing the "Fn+D" keys.

topRowFunctions.description: The top row of the keyboard provides the following two functions. Select the one you want:

subSectionTwo.title: Reversing the default primary function
subSectionTwo.description: When on, the default primary function will be changed from the factory settings to the opposite. Restart your computer to make the changes take effect.

subSectionThree.title: How to use Fn key combinations
subSectionThree.description: Using the Normal method, to use the Fn key combinations, you need to press Fn+function keys. With the Fn Sticky key method, you can press (instead of pressing and holding) the Fn key to keep it in a pressed condition. Then press the desired function key. The action is equivalent to pressing the function key simultaneously with the Fn key.
subSectionThree.note: When you press the Fn key twice, the Fn key is locked in the pressed condition until you press it again. When the Fn key is locked, the Fn Lock indicator is turned on. You can press the desired function key directly to initiate the non-default function.

smartAssist.title: Smart Assist
smartAssist.description: Lenovo Intelligent Sensing combines sensors on your computer to detect your activities, adjust settings for optimal power management, and protect your privacy.

HumanPresenceDetection.title: Human Presence Detection
HumanPresenceDetection.tooltip: Click here to reset the human presence detection settings.

humanPresenceDetection.title: User Presence Sensing
humanPresenceDetection.tooltip: Click here to reset human presence Detection settings.

zeroTouchLogin.title: Zero Touch Login
zeroTouchLogin.caption: This feature unlocks or wakes up the computer automatically when you are in front of it or approaching it.
zeroTouchLogin.tooltip: When you are in front of your computer or approaching it (within the distance of 1.2 meters), this feature enables you to automatically log in to the system after your face is recognized. If you are in outdoor rather than the office, you need to be closer to your computer and the wakeup will take longer.

zeroTouchLock.title: Zero Touch Lock
zeroTouchLock.caption: This feature will dim the display and lock the computer when the user presence is not detected. It can reduce the chances of unauthorized access to the computer when you leave with the computer unattended and unlocked. It also reduces the power consumption by putting the system into Modern Standby when your presence is not detected.

autoScreenLockTimer.title: AUTO SCREEN LOCK TIMER
autoScreenLockTimer.toolTipContent: Select your desired option to lock your screen at a Fast/Medium/Slow speed when your presence is not detected. However, the time when the screen will be locked is also impacted by the actual user scenario, the sensor capability, and the Windows screen timeout settings. So, we strongly suggest you instantly lock your system before you leave.

facialRecognition.title: FACIAL RECOGNITION
facialRecognition.caption: You can enable the facial recognition feature and allow it to access your camera. This tool captures your image in order to accurately recognize your presence or detect when you have left your device unattended. This data is processed locally on your device. Lenovo does not access or use it.
facialRecognition.checkBox: Turn on the camera and enable this feature

note.permission: Lenovo Vantage doesn't have access to Camera. The function of the checkbox won't work.
note.privacyMode: Lenovo Vantage Camera privacy mode is on. The function of the checkbox won't work.
note.windowsLink: Go to Windows Settings to give access
note.privacyLink: Go to Camera privacy mode to turn it off

distanceSensitivityAdjusting.title: DISTANCE SENSITIVITY ADJUSTING
distanceSensitivityAdjusting.caption: Distance Sensitivity Adjusting will automatically update the detection distance via an AI engine.

tooltipcontent.context1: When enabled, the detection distance will be automatically adjusted. You also can manually set the detection distance by the slider. The options are:
tooltipcontent.context2: When you manually set the detection distance, please pay attention to the following:

list.line4: The maximum detection distance is 1.2 meters. If exceeding 1.2 meters, the sensor will fail to detect your presence.
list.line5: The recommended detection distance is within 0.60 meters.

note.description1: This feature relies on Windows Hello. Make sure face recognition is turned on in windows settings.
note.description2: The feature uses sensors and camera to detect your presence. However, the feature does NOT collect any personal data.
note.description3: 1. If your computer is in Tent, Tablet or Stand mode, these features might not work appropriately.
note.description4: 2. If your computer is in hibernation mode or has been turned off, Zero Touch Login will not work.
note.description5: 3. Please adjust your computer screen to an appropriate angle so that IR camera can recognize your face for auto login.
note.description6: 4. If the Airplane mode is enabled on your computer, these features are disabled.
note.description7: The accuracy varies by body size, posture, and frequency of movement. If your computer is locked unexpectedly, adjust the sensitivity bar to improve the accuracy.

intelligentScreen.title: Intelligent Screen
intelligentScreen.description: Lenovo Intelligent Sensing combines the various sensors on your computer to detect your activities and adjust settings for power management. For example, it will dim your display if it detects you are walking but will not dim it if it detects you reading.

autoScreenOff.title: Auto Screen Off
autoScreenOff.caption: Automatically turn off display when face-down or walking.
autoScreenOff.note: This feature is not available if your Power Plan settings are set to "never turn off the screen on battery " in the Windows Settings "System section". Please select a value other than "Never" to enable this feature.
autoScreenOff.windowsLink: Go to Power & sleep settings in Windows settings

activeProtectionSystem.description: The Lenovo Active Protection System is an autonomic feature that helps protect your hard drive from damage caused by strong physical shock and vibration. It continuously monitors that movement of your computer and temporarily stops the hard drive when a fall or similar damaging event is predicted.

voice.description: Lenovo Voice converts your voice into text with the Voice to Text and provides assistance of real-time speech translation with the Translation Assistant.

voiceToText.title: Voice to Text
voiceToText.caption: This feature provides voice typing function that converts voice into text for quick input.

translation.title: Translation
translation.caption: This feature provides real-time translation assistance of speeches and all the translated will be shown in text. Multiple languages are available for the source and target language.

modalPopUp.heading: Getting started:
modalPopUp.point1: Start Lenovo Voice from Start Menu and the Lenovo Voice icon is displayed in the Windows system tray.
modalPopUp.point2: Open the application where you want to type in text.
modalPopUp.point3: Click the Lenovo Voice icon in the Windows system tray and select Voice to text.
modalPopUp.point4: Select the languages by your need and click the microphone icon to start.
modalPopUp.point5: Put the cursor in the application and begin to speak.
modalPopUp.point6: Click the Lenovo Voice icon in the Windows system tray and select Translation.
modalPopUp.point7: Select your source language and target language.
modalPopUp.point8: Depending on your need, set the voice input from Speaker or from Microphone.
modalPopUp.point9: Click the microphone icon to start speaking.
modalPopUp.point10: Make sure that the Lenovo Voice icon is displayed in the Windows system tray.

landing.uacText: User Account Control is a very important security feature of Windows helps prevent potentially harmful programs from making changes to your system.
landing.windowsTitle: Why I need to activate Windows?
landing.windowsText: Running a non-genuine copy of Windows can put you at greater risk for virus and other security threats.
landing.encryptionText: It helps to protect your data by providing encryption for entire hard drive from unauthorized access even though the drive is removed from current PC and put into other devices.
landing.passwordText: Securely store and manage all your passwords encrypted by a professional digital protection app instead of simply storing in your browsers which can be easily accessed by 3rd parties without your knowledge.
landing.enhanceTitle: What should I do to enhance security protection?
landing.enhanceText: We highly recommend you to have your devices protected by anti-virus software and firewall, set up UAC notification at minimum protection. And create strong passwords and manage in a secure way, encrypt your data while using public network as advanced protection.
landing.antivirusContent: Use an Anti-virus software to prevent, detect and remove malware for your devices.
landing.firewallContent: Firewall establishes a barrier between a trusted internal network and untrusted external network, which monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules.
landing.windowsActiveContent: Use a genuine copy of Windows can put you at lower risk for security threats.
landing.passwordContent: Use a more secure and easy way to manage your passwords, payments and personal information. And even create strong, complex passwords and login instantly on every site.
landing.fingerprintContent: A fast and secure way to sign in to Windows, make payments and connect to apps and services.
landing.uacContent: Move the slider to select how much you want User Account Control to protect you from potentially harmful changes.
landing.wifiContent: An advanced software service that helps your device differentiate safe wireless networks from potentially malicious ones.
landing.bitLockerContent: Help protect your files and folders from unauthorized access by encrypting data on your hard drive.
landing.vpnContent: A Virtual Private Network (VPN) uses encryption to keep your online activity secure and private, and helps prevent hackers from stealing your personal information over Wi-Fi.
landing.haveOwnPassword: I have my own password health
landing.haveOwnWifi: I have my own wifi security
landing.fully: To get a better offer protect your device, stay with
landing.notFully: To learn how to better protect your device, start with
landing.noProtectionDesc: Your device has no security protection, so we enable Windows Defender for you as a minimum protection. To protect your device from incoming threats, try installing anti-virus software.
landing.basicDesc: Your device has only basic security protection enabled. For better protection, try enabling UAC notifications and using a password manager.
landing.intermediateDesc: Good job! You are only one step way from getting advanced protection, try encrypting your data and monitoring your network security breaches.
landing.advancedDesc: Congratulations! Your device has basic, intermediate and advanced security protection enabled, great job!

question1.title: Backup and restore your files
question1.description:
Backup and restore your files
It's always good to have a backup. Keep copies of your files on another drive in case something happens to the originals.
Set up your backup
Select the Start button, select Settings > Update & security > Backup > Add a drive , and then choose an external drive or network location for your backups.
All set. Every hour, we'll backup everything in your user folder (C:\Users\username). To change which files get backed up or how often backups happen, go to More options.
Restore your files
If you're missing an important file or folder, here's how to get it back:
1. Type Restore files in the search box on the taskbar, and then select Restore your files with File History.
2. Look for the file you need, then use the arrows to see all its versions
3. When you find the version you want, select Restore to save it in its original location. To save it in a different place, press and hold (or right-click) Restore, select Restore to, and then choose a new location.

question2.title: How to reset your PC
question2.description:
How to Reset Windows 10
If your Windows 10 PC is experiencing issues or you are selling it, you should reset it. Performing a reset lets you choose to keep or remove your files, removes all apps and settings, and installs a fresh copy of Windows. This can also fix many problems such as slow performance.
1. Open the Settings app
Press the Start Image button which is located on the bottom-left of your screen and choose the settings gear Image.
2. Select Update & security from the list of categories
3. Navigate to Recovery from the left pane
4. Start the reset process
Under the "Reset this PC" heading at the top, click or tap on the Get started button.
5. Choose whether to keep your files or not
After the reset, you can sign in to your Microsoft account. Any Windows Store apps purchased under this account will reinstall.
  • Keep my files removes your apps and settings, but keeps all of your personal files.
  • Remove everything erases your apps, settings, and personal files. If you don't have a backed-up copy of your files, you may want to press cancel, back them up, and begin this process again.
6. You can choose different additional settings
This will only show if you selected "Remove everything" in the previous step.
7.Read the overview and press Reset when you are ready to proceed.
Windows will prepare to reset your device. Simply wait until you're taken to a blue screen.
8. When "Choose an option" comes up, select Continue.
Windows will restart and begin resetting. Your PC may reboot several times as the reset is occurring.
Community Q&A
If I choose to remove everything, does it erase all the drives in/connected to my computer or only the one that I'm running Windows 10 on?
Community Answer
It'll only erase the Windows 10 OS drive (usually C: drive). Other drives in/connected to your computer won't be affected.
How can I do this if my screen is broken?
Community Answer
You can't, unfortunately. You will need to get a new screen.
If I've logged into any website, will that history be removed as well?
Community Answer
Yes, depending on what browser you are using. To remove your browser history, just go to your settings in the browser and delete your history. You can also use incognito modes to avoid having your history saved.
If I choose to remove everything, will it reset my password too?
Community Answer
Yes, once you reset your Windows 10 computer, it will remove all user data. This includes documents, stored passwords, pictures, preferred settings, browser information, and application data.
Reference
How to Reset Windows 10 – WikiHow.

question3.title: How to know your machine's CPU
question3.description:
How to know your machine's CPU

Symptom

The terms 32-bit and 64-bit refer to the way a computer's processor (also called a CPU), handles information.The 64-bit version of Windows handles large amounts of random access memory (RAM) more effectively than a 32-bit system.

Affected Brands

The above symptom is associated with, but not limited to, the following systems:

  • All Desktops and Laptops

Operating System

  • Windows 7, 8, 10

Solution

Windows 7 or Vista

  1. Open System by clicking the Start button Picture of the Start button, right-clicking Computer, and then clicking Properties
  2. Under System, you can view the system type.

Windows 8 and Windows 10

Method 1: View the System window in Control Panel

  1. Swipe in from the right edge of the screen, and then tap Search. Or, if you are using a mouse, point to the lower-right corner of the screen, and then click Search.
  2. Type system in the search box, and then tap or click Settings.
  3. Tap or click System
  4. If you are running a 64-bit version of Windows 8, 64-bit Operating System is displayed in the System type field under the System heading.If you are running a 32-bit version of Windows 8, 32-bit Operating System is displayed in the System type field under the System heading.

Method 2: View the System Information window

  1. Swipe in from the right edge of the screen, and then tap Search. Or, if you are using a mouse, point to the lower-right corner of the screen, and then click Search.
  2. In the search box, type system information
  3. Tap or click System, tap or click System Information, and then click System Summary.
  4. If you are running a 64-bit version of Windows 8, x64-based PC is displayed in the System type field under the Item heading.

    If you are running a 32-bit version of Windows 8, x86-based PC is displayed in the System type field under the Item heading.

question4.title: Check your machine's battery use
question4.description:
Check your machine's battery use

Symptom

Windows 10 includes a new “Battery Use” screen that shows you what’s draining your laptop’s juice.That means it’ll tell you exactly what apps–both desktop and Windows 10 “universal”apps–are using too much power.

Affected Brands

  • Lenovo laptops, desktops

Affected Systems

  • All

Operating System

  • Window 10

Solution

This feature is new in Windows 10, we need to find this feature first as it is not stored in your traditional control panel view, this feature is located in the new “Settings” app


A. Find the Battery Use Screen

1. Click or Tap the “Settings” option from the start menu

2. In Settings select “System”and then select “Battery saver.”


3. Click or tap the “Battery use” link under this heading to see more details.

B. Analyze Your Power Usage

4. You can change to make the battery use screen to display battery use from last 24 hours to last 48 hours or last from last week

5. “System,” “Display,” and “Wi-Fi” percentages. This shows how much battery power has been used by system processes,the display.

6. The “In use” and “Background” options show how much power is used by applications while you’re using them, compared to applications running in the background.

7. If apps are using power in the background, you can click or tap the “Change background app settings” link and configure apps to not run in the background.This only works for universal Windows 10 apps.

8. Scroll down further and you will see a list of applications, this is considered as the most useful section of this feature.It will display a list of the apps have used battery power in that period, and show you what percentage of your battery power each app has used

question5.title: Use your PC like a tablet
question5.description:
Use your PC like a tablet

Tablet mode makes Windows more intuitive and easier to use when you have a touch screen device.

Use tablet mode

To turn on tablet mode, select action center on the taskbar, then select Tablet mode.

Note

To find out if your device can automatically turn on tablet mode, search for your device on the manufacturer's website. Support for this feature depends on the hardware, the driver that's installed, and how the device was set up by the manufacturer.

In tablet mode, apps open full screen, giving you more space to work. To close an app, drag it to the bottom of the screen.

Tip

The taskbar is available when your PC is in tablet mode, but you can hide it if you want more room on the screen. Select the Start button, select Settings > System > Tablet mode , then turn on Automatically hide the taskbar in tablet mode. To see the hidden taskbar, swipe up from the bottom of the screen, or use your mouse to hover there.

Use two apps simultaneously

To use two apps side by side in tablet mode, drag an open app down and to the side. You'll see where it'll snap, and you'll see any open apps next to it.

In this view, you can also:

  • Use the shared edge between two snapped apps to resize both apps at the same time.
  • Open a new app from task view—select Task view on the taskbar, select an app, then drag it to one side to snap it into your divided screen.
  • Use the back button on the taskbar to go back in an app, or to open an app that you were using before.

question6.title: Get to know Cortana, your personal assistant
question6.description:
Get to know Cortana, your personal assistant

What is Cortana?

Cortana is your digital agent. She'll help you get things done.

The more you use Cortana, the more personalized your experience will be.

To get started, type a question in the search box, or select the microphone and talk to Cortana. (Typing works for all types of PCs, but you need a mic to talk.)

If you’re not sure what to say, you’ll see suggestions on your lock screen, and in Cortana home when you select the search box on the taskbar.

  1. Home 2. Notebook 3. Settings 4. Feedback

Here are some things Cortana can do for you:

  • Give you reminders based on time, places, or people.
  • Track packages, teams, interests, and flights.
  • Send emails and texts.
  • Manage your calendar and keep you up to date.
  • Create and manage lists.
  • Chit chat and play games.
  • Find facts, files, places, and info.
  • Open any app on your system.

Try this: Set a reminder

One of the things Cortana can do is to give you reminders. She can remind you to do things based on time, places, or even people.

For example, type or say, 'Remind me to congratulate Tanya the next time she calls'.

The reminder will appear when you get a call from Tanya.

Extra bonus—if you have a Windows phone or Cortana for iPhone or Android, you can set Cortana to sync notifications between your PC and phone.

Hey Cortana?

Set Cortana to hear you anytime you say 'Hey Cortana'. Select the search box on the taskbar to open Cortana home. Then select Settings and turn on Let Cortana respond to 'Hey Cortana'.

Note

Cortana is only available in certain countries/regions, and some Cortana features might not be available everywhere.

battery.title: Enable Battery Charge Threshold
battery.description: Enabling a custom battery charge will allow for the overall battery health to last longer as you use this device. However, not having a full charge will allow less runtime battery life. In order to fully enable this feature, please unplug your machine and allow your battery to drain or below the stop-charging threshold.

hardwareScan.refreshMessage: Refresh may take some time as it needs to load all the components again

menu.security: Do you know? Even you don't have anti-virus software installed, we still provide basic security protection for your device.
menu.connectedHomeSecurity: Get real-time monitoring and alerts about your network security at home. You will be the first one to know if any of your smart devices are facing a security attack.

heroBanner.description: Lenovo exclusive offer of Adobe designer suite

dccDetails.body11: Premiere Pro is the leading video editing software for film, TV and the web. Premiere Pro includes Premiere Rush, an all-in-one app that works across all your devices to share your video with your network.
dccDetails.body12: Use Lightroom to easily edit, organize, store, and share your photos from anywhere, and Photoshop so you can transform your images to anything you can imagine.
dccDetails.body2: All-in-One PCs with 9th Gen Intel® Core™ processors give you all the power of a desktop packaged in a sleek display — for less clutter, hardware-based security, and a hi-res display.
